nodes.bodyText: SCIM_AUTH_URL - for APIs such as create user, change password, reset password etc. HYDRA_ADMIN_URL to access APIs such as /token, /introspection etc from ORY Hydra.

nodes.bodyText:
why not move  into a variable to be replaced as well?
AppName should come from the database app record associated with the study.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -76,7 +67,7 @@ certificate.password=XXXX
 
 confirmation.mail.subject=Welcome to the <App Name> App!

nodes.bodyText:
Please find inline comment by BA team on this change.
 This should be dynamically replaced from the app information stored in the database, depending on the app (App ID) fhat the email is being sent out for. We have a task in Track 1 (release 2) for centralization of all branding elements across platform components so that developers don't need to replace values in multiple places in the code. As part of this, elements such as app name is to be read from the database for the app in question. This should get addressed by the end of release 2.

nodes.bodyText:
@madhurya-btc please add the comments to properties and put hardcoded values. Also update these properties on other services and raise one more PR.
# The default port: 587 for smtp protocol
spring.mail.port=587

# Email Protocols - POP3, SMTP and IMAP, The default protocol: 'smtp'.
spring.mail.protocol=smtp
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -86,26 +78,42 @@ feedback.email= feedback.mail.subject= App Feedback: -feedback.mail.content=
Hi
A user of the <App Name> mobile app has provided feedback via the app. Here's the content of the feedback:
$body
Thanks,The <Org Name> MyStudies Support Team-------------------------------------------Note: This is an auto-generated email. Please do not reply.
+feedback.mail.content=
Hi
A user of the <App Name> mobile app has provided feedback via the app. Here's the content of the feedback:
@body@
Thanks,The @orgName@ MyStudies Support Team-------------------------------------------Note: This is an auto-generated email. Please do not reply.
contactus.email= contactus.mail.subject= App Helpdesk: -contactus.mail.content=
Hi
A user of the <App Neme> mobile app has reached out this helpdesk via the 'Contact Us' form in the mobile app. The details submitted in the form are given below:
___________________________________________
First Name: $firstName
Email: $email
Subject: $subject
Message: $body
___________________________________________
Please respond to the app user at the email provided.
Thanks,The <Org Name> MyStudies Support Team-------------------------------------------Note: This is an auto-generated email. Please do not reply.
+contactus.mail.content=
Hi
A user of the <App Name> mobile app has reached out this helpdesk via the 'Contact Us' form in the mobile app. The details submitted in the form are given below:
___________________________________________
First Name: @firstName@
Email: @email@
Subject: @subject@
Message: @body@
___________________________________________
Please respond to the app user at the email provided.
Thanks,The @orgName@ MyStudies Support Team-------------------------------------------Note: This is an auto-generated email. Please do not reply.
# Feedback & Contactus mail content ends -security.oauth2.client.client-id= oauth-scim-client-id -security.oauth2.client.client-secret= oauth-scim-client-secret +security.oauth2.client.client-id=${CLIENT_ID} +security.oauth2.client.client-secret=${SECRET_KEY} -security.oauth2.introspection_endpoint=http://35.193.185.224:8087/oauth-scim-service/oauth2/introspect -security.oauth2.token_endpoint=http://35.193.185.224:8087/oauth-scim-service/oauth2/token -security.oauth2.client.redirect-uri=http://35.193.185.224:8087/oauth-scim-service/login +security.oauth2.introspection_endpoint=${HYDRA_ADMIN_URL}/oauth2/introspect +security.oauth2.token_endpoint=${SCIM_AUTH_URL}/oauth2/token +security.oauth2.client.redirect-uri= ${LOGIN_REDIRECT_URL} spring.main.allow-bean-definition-overriding=true org.name = Org Name +# mail smtp configs +spring.mail.default-encoding=UTF-8 +spring.mail.host=${MAIL_HOST} +spring.mail.username=${MAIL_USERNAME} +spring.mail.password=${MAIL_PASSWORD} +spring.mail.port=${MAIL_PORT} +spring.mail.protocol=${MAIL_PROTOCOL}

nodes.bodyText: Fixed review comment. Created an issue #1030 for other service changes
